name: unsterilized
content:
unsterilized adjective
(DIRTY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unsterilized object has not been made completely clean or free from bacteria. : Unsterilized instruments had been used. Transmission through the use of unsterilised needles and syringes was common. Related word
sterilize (CLEAN)
More examplesFewer examplesBacteria can be transported from patient to patient by unsterilized equipment.

unsterilized adjective
(ABLE TO HAVE YOUNG/CHILDREN)
An unsterilized animal or person has not had a medical operation to make it impossible for it or them to have young animals or babies: There are fines for owners who let their unsterilized pets run free. These women remained unsterilized. Related word
sterilize (STOP CHILDREN)

unsterilized adjective
(MONEY)
finance & economics
  specialized allowing a country's money supply to be affected when money is bought or sold on international money markets: unsterilized intervention The central bank injected billions into the banking system through unsterilized intervention in the foreign exchange markets. Some of the intervention was unsterilized.
